snippet.title: PNG GG giving O'Neil the nod to form gov't not illegal or unconstitutional
snippet.content: Papua New Guinea's Governor General inviting Peter O'Neil to form a government before all the election results are in is not illegal or unconstitutional. That's according to constitutional law expert, Auckland University professor Bill Hodge. He says the Governor General, Sir Bob Dadae, is probably trying to do the best he can to ensure the formation of a government under very difficult and challenging circumstances.
